articles.title: GOP Nightmare? Giuliani ‘would testify’ at Trump trial as insiders push him away
articles.description: After stonewalling evidence and witnesses in the impeachment investigation, in a new interview, Trump’s personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani says he ‘would testify’ in Trump’s impeachment trial. But many republicans want Giuliani to stop “helping” Trump, a top Senat…

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: 'Schoolhouse Rock!' singer, voice of 'I’m Just a Bill' dies at 88
articles.description: Jazz musician Jack Sheldon died on Dec. 22.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump's max pressure policy on Iran unleashes sophisticated response
articles.description: Senior Foreign Affairs Analyst Brett McGurk talks about the “tit for tat” cycle of violence in the Middle East and how to break that cycle.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Lieberman: Lawmakers met privately during Clinton impeachment
articles.description: "We worked it out as colleagues," former Sen. Joe Lieberman (I-Conn.) says about President Clinton's impeachment. "I hope and pray ... that the Senate today can find a way to do the same."

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Report: Unredacted emails reveal Pentagon’s legal concerns over Ukraine aid freeze
articles.description: New reporting finds unredacted emails between the White House and the Pentagon which appear to reveal that the Ukraine aid freeze was coming at the clear direction of President Trump, ignoring concerns from the Defense Department

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Twin foreign policy crises greet Trump in the new year
articles.description: Donald Trump sends hundreds of more troops to the Middle East after the U.S. embassy in Iraq was attacked, while North Korea’s leader Kim Jong Un vows to expand the country’s nuclear capabilities

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: U.S.- Iran tensions high after Baghdad embassy attack
articles.description: After two days of dangerous demonstrations at the U.S. embassy in Baghdad, the militia has withdrawn. But in the aftermath of the attack, there are renewed questions about President Trump's "maximum pressure" campaign on Iran, and whether it's spilling over o…

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Thursday's Mini-Report, 1.2.20
articles.content:
Today’s edition of quick hits:
* Conditions in Baghdad: Iraqi protesters withdrew from the perimeter of the U.S. Embassy compound in Baghdad on the second day of demonstrations against deadly U.S. airstrikes last weekend, U.S. officials said.
* A deadly nig… [+2246 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Lieberman: I hope McConnell, Schumer will 'rise to the occasion' of impeachment
articles.description: Former Sen. Joe Lieberman (I-Conn.) joins Meet the Press Daily to talk about the upcoming Senate impeachment trial and the partisanship of Congress.

articles.title: State of emergency declared as Australia fires rage on
articles.description: Australia has been on fire for months and the rest of the world is hardly paying attention. Why? David Wallace-Wells of New York Magazine joins Katy Tur to discuss.

articles.title: Sanders raises $34.5M in fourth quarter
articles.description: The panel discusses the implications of the latest round of fundraising numbers for 2020 candidates.

articles.title: Chief Justice John Roberts: Americans “take democracy for granted”
articles.description: In his annual year-end report on the federal judiciary, Chief Justice of the United States John Roberts stresses the dangers of misinformation and the importance of judicial independence. MSNBC’s Ali Velshi talks with Jeffrey Rosen, President and CEO of the N…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: The super rich who are willing to pay more in taxes
articles.description: Ali Velshi talks with New Yorker staff writer Sheelah Kolhatkar about her new article which looks at a group of wealthy Americans who say they are willing to pay more in taxes to fight income inequality in the U.S.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Toughest data privacy law in U.S. now in effect in CA
articles.description:
The California Consumer Privacy Act gives nearly 40 million people the right to control how their personal data is used and by whom. 
Michael Fertik, founder and managing partner of Heroic Ventures, joins Ali Velshi to discuss the strengths of the new law and…
